title.narrative: 001 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SECTOR COORDINATION

description.narrative: 'Enhanced support for children, families and institutions leading to resilient, equitable use of safe and adequate gender- sensitive water and sanitation services with increased hygiene knowledge and attitude focusing on children under 5 in rural areas, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2020, the Ethiopian population (including refugees and asylum seekers) in particular women, children, adolescent girls and vulnerable groups, use affordable, safe, reliable, sustainable and adequate water supply, sanitation and appropriate hygiene practices in households, communities and institutions in rural and urban areas

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'Enhanced support for children, families and institutions leading to resilient, equitable use of safe and adequate gender-sensitive water and sanitation services with increased hygiene knowledge and attitude focusing on children under 5 in rural areas

description.narrative: UNICEF coordinated the COVID-19 response with key stakeholders after the first case was recorded in Ethiopia at the beginning of March 2020. The prevalence of the COVID epidemic and subsequent movement restrictions put in place by Government has affected the implementation of development activities specifically the construction works. UNICEF led the conceptualization of climate resilient WASH programming and as a result of the successes achieved by UNICEF the Government of Ethiopia (GoE) through its flagship programme, the One WASH National Programme (OWNP) is rolling out Climate Resilient WaSH (CR-WaSH) service provision demonstrating humanitarian/development linkages. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

title.narrative: Existence of a national plan with target to provide access to drinking water to unserved populations

actual.value: 2020:The One WASH National programme document is being implemented. The plan has components of climate resilient WASH to address equity.

title.narrative: National Monitoring system capturing data on behavioral change information(60946)

actual.value: 2020:Concept notes on monitoring of Sanitation (Sanitation MIS) is being developed. The MIS is planned to include indicators on behavioural change communication

title.narrative: % of CWA funds used for gender and disability friendly institutional WASH(43814)

actual.value: 2020:As per administrative data from the regions, 12% of the CWA budget was allocated to institutional WASH.

title.narrative: WASH sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available

actual.value: 2020:Climate Resilient WASH and Low land WASH are components of phase II of OWNP and being implemented.
